item.title: Why This Farmer Is Facing a $2.8 Million Fine for Plowing His Own Field
item.description: John Duarte thought he was in line with the law when he started to plow his new property, now he's heading to court, fighting a $2.8 million fine.

item.title: Danger Growing: What Would War with N. Korea Look Like?
item.description: The U.S. is conducting a missile defense test today after North Korea fired off yet another threatening missile Monday.  Pyongyang launched a Scud-class missile into the sea, the latest in a fast-paced series of missile tests defying international pressure and threats of more sanctions.

item.title: Texas Takes a Step to Keep Sharia Law Out of American Courts
item.description: And they're not alone.

item.title: LOVE YOUR NEIGHBOR: One Woman in Need Surprised by her Co-workers Sacrifice
item.description: Tia Benbow will be able to keep her job.

item.title: CHILLING: 'Pull off a Leg or Two.' Abortionists Admit to Tearing Babies Limb from Limb
item.description: A new video from the Center for Medical Progress features attendees at an abortion conference. Many openly share gruesome stories of illegal acts against babies.

item.title: IN MEMORY: 'Old Guard' Places 280,000+ Flags at Arlington Cemetery
item.description: This weekend millions of Americans pause on Memorial Day to honor the nation's heroes and reflect on the sacrifices of its fallen soldiers. In that vein, soldiers from the 3rd Infantry Regiment placed flags this week at more than 280,000 graves of fallen service members.

item.title: Student Banned from Giving Faith-Filled Graduation Speech Still Found a Way
item.description: One brave boy refused to keep quiet about his faith.

item.title: Football Player Who Had Lunch With Autistic Boy Signs with New York Giants
item.description: One athlete's gesture of kindness made all the difference for a little boy... and ultimately his kindness was rewarded.

item.title: Thanks to These Websites, Your Personal Info Is Just a Keystroke Away
item.description: Is your sensitive information available online? Everything about you could be a keystroke away.

item.title: Michael Buble's Son Completely Healed of Cancer
item.description: Buble's wife says the healing is a "miracle."

item.title: How One Woman Gave Her Sister the Gift of Motherhood
item.description: Children are indeed a gift from God!

item.title: 7 Bible Verses and a Prayer on this Memorial Day Weekend
item.description: On Memorial Day, we honor the heroes of the Armed Forces who sacrificed their lives for our freedom. Here are Bible verses and a prayer to help you focus this weekend.

item.title: U.S. Plans First Test To Intercept Mock Missile On Tuesday
item.description: The Missile Defense Agency plans to conduct the first test of ICBN Intercept, with North Korea in mind.

item.title: It's Not What You Think: 'Yes, I'm a Christian and I Love to Smoke'
item.description: I love to smoke outside, sitting on my back porch looking out at my freshly mown backyard. I love to smoke all day; starting early in the morning and going late into the afternoon and early evening.

item.title: Rehab Gone Wrong: Men Charged with Overseeing Drug Addicts Die of OverdosesÂ
item.description: 2 counselors at a Pennsylvania drug treatment center die of overdoses of fentanyl and heroin.

item.description: DHS chief: If you knew what I knew about terror, youâd ânever leave the houseâ

item.title: Six Babies! Couple Welcomes Sextuplets After 17-Year Struggle with Infertility
item.description: Adeboye and Ajibola Taiwo of Richmond, Virginia, recently became parents to sextuplets. The Nigerian couple tried for 17 years to have children. In November they were overjoyed when doctors told them they detected four heartbeats on their first ultrasound. But in January, they learned they were expecting two more babies, for a total of six.

item.title: 'Watchmen on the Wall' to Faith Leaders: 'You're Not Alone in the Fight'
item.description: A conference called "Watchmen on the Wall" kicked off in Washington, D.C., this week with the goal of lifting up and strengthening pastors and spiritual leaders.

item.title: The VA's 'Toxic Culture': Cockroaches Found Over and Over on Food at Veterans Hospital
item.description: The Hines, Illinois VA hospital has been knowingly serving food invested with cockroaches to veterans, according to a new report by the Office of the Inspector General.

item.title: What's the Secret to This Rural Church's 900 Baptisms in 6 Years?
item.description: Rural Alabama Church sees 900 baptisms in just 6 years. What's their secret?

item.title: How This Christian Singer Is Helping Double the Chance of Survival for the Unborn
item.description: Joyce Im Bartholomew's newest music video, "Please Forgive Me," is all about sin, repentance and forgiveness. While she loves singing, she also cherishes her life-saving role as spokeswoman for the unborn.
